org.dhbw.geo.database

Class DBCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dhbw.geo.database.DBObject
      • org.dhbw.geo.database.DBCondition
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DBConditionFence, DBConditionTime

    public abstract class DBCondition
extends DBObject
    A condition is used to define whether the rule's actions shall be triggered or not.
    Author:
    Matthias

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String name
      the name of the condition (an arbitrary name given by the user)
      private DBRule rule
      the rule the condition is assigned to

      • DBCondition

        public DBCondition()

      • DBCondition

        public DBCondition(long id,
                   java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new condition. Use this to create conditions fetched from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the condition
        name - the name of the condition

    • Method Detail

      • selectAllFromDB

        public static java.util.ArrayList<DBCondition> selectAllFromDB(long ruleId)
        Selects all conditions from the database which are assigned to a given rule.
        Parameters:
        ruleId - the id of the rule for which the conditions shall be selected
        Returns:
        an arraylist of the conditions fetched from the database

      • setRule

        public void setRule(DBRule rule)

      • removeRuleFromDB

        public abstract void removeRuleFromDB()
        Removes the conjunction to the rule. This doesn't delete the rule or the condition either.

      • writeRuleToDB

        protected abstract void writeRuleToDB()
        Inserts the conjunction of the condition with the assigned rule.

      • isConditionMet

        public abstract boolean isConditionMet()
        Checks whether the condition is fulfilled.
        Returns:
        true if the condition is fulfilled, false otherwise

      • getRule

        public DBRule getRule()

        public java.lang.String getName()
